snippet.textDisplay: +Moop Bread why? His original is forte which is a musical term which means loud. His dog is called gospel and in english is Treble. So the names are all sound based. Even megaman his original name is rockman which if you look that up it is a refernece to rock music...his sister is named roll. Rockman and Roll rock n roll. Japanese like to do that for some reason...like in bakuretsu hunter (sorcerer hunters in usa) the characters are all named after food. In other series you similar trends.
snippet.textOriginal: +Moop Bread why? His original is forte which is a musical term which means loud. His dog is called gospel and in english is Treble. So the names are all sound based. Even megaman his original name is rockman which if you look that up it is a refernece to rock music...his sister is named roll. Rockman and Roll rock n roll. Japanese like to do that for some reason...like in bakuretsu hunter (sorcerer hunters in usa) the characters are all named after food. In other series you similar trends.

snippet.textDisplay:
I have to admit Forte (Bass) has an edge over Rock (Mega Man) in this game. Even though he doesn't get the Auto-Healing item, unlike Rock.

Besides, I found Gospel Boost was a somewhat fun alternative to riding the life-rafts across the water in this stage. ^_^;
snippet.textOriginal:
I have to admit Forte (Bass) has an edge over Rock (Mega Man) in this game. Even though he doesn't get the Auto-Healing item, unlike Rock.

Besides, I found Gospel Boost was a somewhat fun alternative to riding the life-rafts across the water in this stage. ^_^;

snippet.textDisplay: @SupraDarky The GBA version has a smaller screen and doesn't go as far, making some parts (namely fighting King's fusion form as Megaman) more difficult than they should be. I'd just mod a Game Genie to import the SFC version, it's more than worth it. Plus, the SFC OST is better than the GBA OST.
snippet.textOriginal: @SupraDarky The GBA version has a smaller screen and doesn't go as far, making some parts (namely fighting King's fusion form as Megaman) more difficult than they should be. I'd just mod a Game Genie to import the SFC version, it's more than worth it. Plus, the SFC OST is better than the GBA OST.

snippet.textDisplay: This was released so late for the SNES (same year as a game like Ocarina of Time) that it only﻿ got released in Japan. It was later ported here for the GBA as Mega Man & Bass. It's a great MM game, unsurprisingly. I especially like the bass in this track.
snippet.textOriginal: This was released so late for the SNES (same year as a game like Ocarina of Time) that it only﻿ got released in Japan. It was later ported here for the GBA as Mega Man & Bass. It's a great MM game, unsurprisingly. I especially like the bass in this track.
